thread.title: James Corden And Neil Patrick Harris Do A Broadway Riff-Off And We All Win
thread.title_full: James Corden And Neil Patrick Harris Do A Broadway Riff-Off And We All Win

author: Ali Velez
title: James Corden And Neil Patrick Harris Do A Broadway Riff-Off And We All Win
text:
View this image ›
CBS / Via youtube.com ID: 10300741 3. Apparently, NPH had to settle a score. View this image ›
CBS / Via youtube.com ID: 10300744 4. He reminded James that he’s not the only TV star who is qualified to host The Tony Awards. View this image ›
CBS / Via youtube.com ID: 10300748 5. And James quickly reminded him that he, too, is a Tony winner. View this image ›
CBS / Via youtube.com ID: 10300753 6. But Neil still had to one-up him. View this image ›
CBS / Via youtube.com ID: 10300756 7. So, naturally James laid out a challenge. View this image ›
CBS / Via youtube.com ID: 10300759 8. Challenge ACCEPTED. View this image ›
CBS / Via youtube.com ID: 10300772 9. Backed up by a capella group The Filharmonic, James got things started with a classic from Guys and Dolls . View this image ›
CBS / Via youtube.com The Filharmonic were featured in season 4 of NBC’s The Sing-Off.
ID: 10300785 10. And NPH followed that right up with the iconic “Everything’s Coming Up Roses” from Gypsy . View this image ›
CBS / Via youtube.com Oh, it’s ON.
ID: 10300789 11. In the second round, the men show off their serious vocal skills. First up, NPH kills with Sondheim’s “Being Alive,” which is just gorgeous. View this image ›
CBS / Via youtube.com ID: 10300795 12. And James brought down the house with a beautifully sustained high note at the end of “On My Own” from Lés Miserables . View this image ›
CBS / Via youtube.com ID: 10300807 13. Then, it was time to bring the sex. James did just that with this hot little number from Chicago . View this image ›
CBS / Via youtube.com ID: 10300835 14. But of course, Neil just crushed everything with “Sugar Daddy” from Hedwig and the Angry Inch . View this image ›
CBS / Via youtube.com Neil Patrick Harris won the 2014 Tony Award for Lead Actor in a Musical as the title character in Hedwig and the Angry Inch .
ID: 10300842 15. Finally, the two gentlemen joined forces to give us the greatest gift — a duet of “My Shot” from Hamilton . View this image ›
CBS / Via youtube.com Perfection
ID: 10300849 16. Seriously, just watch the whole video and bask in the glorious voices of these two treasures. You won’t be sorry. ID: 10301170
